net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component

Class Window

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.ComponentImpl
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.Container
        • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.Window
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyChangeListener, Iterable<Component>, EventListener, LocaleContextSource, Component, ListCellRenderer, ParentComponent, TableCellRenderer, TreeCellRenderer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Dialog, Frame

    public class Window
extends Container

    The Window object is a top-level container. It contains components that display and/or manipulate user data. It should be associated with an application by using the constructor that takes a MIWTApplication as the only argument. Otherwise modality and other window features will not work properly.

    A Window object will have no title bar or other window widgets. In most cases an instance of Frame (non modal) or Dialog (modal) should be used.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws CannotCloseMIWTException
        This method will remove the window from the WindowManager. The application should not remove the window from the WindowManager. Removes all components and closes the container.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Component
        Overrides:
        close in class Container
        Throws:
        CannotCloseMIWTException - if the window cannot be closed at this time.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from class: ComponentImpl
        Destroy the component and release any resources. This may be called multiple times.

        This is called internally by MIWT. Do not call this method from application code.

        Overrides:
        destroy in class ComponentImpl

      • getLocaleContext

        public LocaleContext getLocaleContext()
        Prefers the application LocaleContext over the parent component LocaleContext. Get the LocaleContext object for this Component. If LocaleContext is null, the parent is asked for the LocaleContext. If there is no parent, a default LocaleContext is returned.
        Specified by:
        getLocaleContext in interface LocaleContextSource
        Specified by:
        getLocaleContext in interface Component
        Overrides:
        getLocaleContext in class ComponentImpl
        Returns:
        LocaleContext.

      • getPosition

        public Point getPosition()
        Get the position of the top left corner of the window.
        Returns:
        Point.

      • getZOrder

        public int getZOrder()
        Returns the z-order of this window in relation to its siblings. The top most window will have the greatest z-order. There is no restriction on the range of values.
        Returns:
        int

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: Component

        Called when a Component is first attached to a WindowManager. This means the Component should have valid return values from getApplication(), getLocaleContext(), getParent(). It is preferable to have all construction of the Component go here since a valid LocaleContext, Application object, etc., are available.

        When overriding this method, be sure to call the super class init(). init() is called only once for each Component. The parent component will have been init()ed before init() is called.

        NOTE: Do not call this method from application code. It is meant to be called by the WindowManager only.

        Specified by:
        init in interface Component
        Overrides:
        init in class ComponentImpl

      • isRenderInline

        public boolean isRenderInline()
        Is render inline.
        Returns:
        true or false. True indicates the window will be rendered inline; otherwise the window will be positioned.

      • preRenderProcess

        public void preRenderProcess(Request request,
                             Response response,
                             RendererEditorState<?> state)
        Description copied from interface: Component
        Allow the component to process any form fields before rendering. This method must be called by subclasses. Method calls on components, creating or destroying components, or nearly everything else having to do with the component tree and related data models must be done by queuing an event using EventQueue.queue(EventQueueElement). Otherwise you may get unexpected results.
        Specified by:
        preRenderProcess in interface Component
        Overrides:
        preRenderProcess in class ComponentImpl
        Parameters:
        request - the request.
        response - the response.
        state - the renderer / editor state, will be null if not using as a renderer / editor.

      • setApplication

        public void setApplication(MIWTApplication app)
        Sets the MIWTApplication instance that owns this Window. This method is set by the WindowManager when adding the Window and should rarely need to be called by application code.
        Parameters:
        app - The new owner of the Window

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • setZOrder

        public void setZOrder(int zorder)
        Sets the z-order. There is no restriction on the range of values. A parent component must set the z-order after it has been added and attached to the parent. This means the z-order is NOT valid during the child component's init() method call.
        Parameters:
        zorder - The z-order to set
        See Also:
        getZOrder()
